aston.group20.model

Class Runway

  • java.lang.Object
    • aston.group20.model.Runway

  • public class Runway
extends java.lang.Object
    The Runway class is used to accommodate Aircraft taking off and landing; it is simple yet critical to the Simulation. It is used in the Airport class, where the Simulation can manipulate it's methods in order to see whether the Runway is available for a plane to takeoff or land. The functionality is relatively simple, using two Integers and a boolean to set the availability of the Runway.
    Version:
    1.0, March 2014
    Author:
    Group_20
    See Also:
    Airport

      Runway()

    • Field Detail

      • isAvailable

        private boolean isAvailable

      • occupiedTime

        private int occupiedTime

      • clearRunway

        private int clearRunway

    • Constructor Detail

      • Runway

        public Runway()
        Creating a new Runway which will set the occupied time and the integer clearRunway which counts up to that occupied time as 0. It will also make sure that the Runway is available upon creation.

    • Method Detail

      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable()
        This method returns a boolean which will show whether or not the Runway is available for use.
        Returns:
        whether or not the Runway is available.

      • setAvailable

        public void setAvailable(boolean isAvailable)
        This method will set the availability of the Runway to the parameter value.
        Parameters:
        isAvailable - whether or not the Runway is available for use.

      • setOccupiedTime

        public void setOccupiedTime(int occupiedTime)
        This method will set the occupied time of the Runway to the parameter value. This means that the Runway will be occupied time for the number of steps that the parameter value is.
        Parameters:
        occupiedTime - the number of steps the Runway will be occupied for.

      • incrementTime

        public void incrementTime()
        This method increments the time of clearRunway. Once this integer either meets or exceeds the occupiedTime integer, they will both be set back to 0 and the isAvailable boolean will be set to true, meaning that the Runway is ready for usage.

      • reset

        public void reset()
